title: Tracking Issue for constify-ing non-trait `Duration` methods

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: Libs-Tracked
labels.description: Libs issues that are tracked on the team's project board.

body:
<!--
Thank you for creating a tracking issue! 📜 Tracking issues are for tracking a
feature from implementation to stabilisation. Make sure to include the relevant
RFC for the feature if it has one. Otherwise provide a short summary of the
feature and link any relevant PRs or issues, and remove any sections that are
not relevant to the feature.

Remember to add team labels to the tracking issue.
For a language team feature, this would e.g., be `T-lang`.
Such a feature should also be labeled with e.g., `F-my_feature`.
This label is used to associate issues (e.g., bugs and design questions) to the feature.
-->

This is a tracking issue for constify-ing non-trait `Duration` methods

The feature gates for the issue are `#![feature(duration_consts_2)]` (stabilized in rust 1.58.0) and `#![feature(duration_consts_float)]` (still unstable).

The following methods will effectively be made const under the `duration_consts_2` feature:
* `Duration::new` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::checked_add` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::saturating_add` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::checked_sub` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::saturating_sub` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::checked_mul` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::saturating_mul` [stable since 1.58.0]
* `Duration::checked_div` [stable since 1.58.0]

The following methods will effectively be made const under the `duration_consts_float` feature:
* `Duration::as_secs_f64` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::as_secs_f32`[stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::div_duration_f64` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::div_duration_f32` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::from_secs_f64` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::from_secs_f32` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::mul_f64` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::mul_f32` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::div_f64` [stabilization blocked by #57241]
* `Duration::div_f32` [stabilization blocked by #57241]

### Steps
<!--
Include each step required to complete the feature. Typically this is a PR
implementing a feature, followed by a PR that stabilises the feature. However
for larger features an implementation could be broken up into multiple PRs.
-->

- [ ] Adjust documentation ([see instructions on rustc-dev-guide][doc-guide])
- [ ] Stabilization PR ([see instructions on rustc-dev-guide][stabilization-guide])

[stabilization-guide]: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stabilization_guide.html#stabilization-pr
[doc-guide]: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stabilization_guide.html#documentation-prs

### Unresolved Questions
<!--
Include any open questions that need to be answered before the feature can be
stabilised.
-->

XXX --- list all the "unresolved questions" found in the RFC to ensure they are
not forgotten

### Implementation history

<!--
Include a list of all the PRs that were involved in implementing the feature.
-->

- [x] Constify most non-trait `Duration` methods as described: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72481
- [x] Make all methods of Duration unstably const: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76335
- [x] Partially stabilize duration_consts_2: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89542
